title: Stop using SVN Keyword Substitution in Solr src code.

comments.author: Steve Rowe
comments.content: +1.  We should remove these from Lucene src code too!

comments.author: Mark Miller
comments.content: Yeah, that's why I didn't consider Lucene - I didn't think it had any - though admittedly, I did not check.

comments.author: Steve Rowe
comments.content:
There are a couple more aliases for the keywords Robert's patch looks for (from http://svnbook.red-bean.com/en/1.7/svn.advanced.props.special.keywords.html) - I've added them to detector.patch.

It still finds the exact same set of files as Robert's version, though.

comments.author: Steve Rowe
comments.content:
One more alias: $Rev$.

This still detects exactly the same set of files as Robert's initial patch.

comments.author: Steve Rowe
comments.content: We should also remove the svn:keyword property from all files, and check that they don't get added again, in the -check-svn-working-copy target.

comments.author: Uwe Schindler
comments.content:
We should also remove the svn:keyword property from all files, and check that they don't get added again, in the -check-svn-working-copy target.

Oh, I have to fix my subversion.conf! :-] In any case: +1
